Module org.nasdanika.resources
Package org.nasdanika.resources

Interface Entity<T,E>

Type Parameters:
T - Entity state type
E - Container element type.
All Superinterfaces:
Resource<E>
All Known Subinterfaces:
BinaryEntity, TypedEntity<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
EphemeralBinaryEntity, EphemeralEntity, FileSystemEntity
public interface Entity<T,E> extends Resource<E>
Entity is something which has externalizable state. E.g. file is an entity with binary contents/state - a sequence of bytes.
Author:
Pavel

  • Method Details

    • getState

      T getState(ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Parameters:
      monitor -
      Returns:
      Entity state.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the entity's underlying state storage does not exist or cannot be read.

    • getState

      default <V> V getState(Class<V> type, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Parameters:
      type - State type
      monitor -
      Returns:
      Entity state converted to the the requested content type. E.g. file contents converted to String. This implementation does not perform any conversion and returns contents AS-IS if it is already of the requested type or throws an UnsupportedOperationException otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the entity state storage does not exist, cannot be read, or conversion from T to V is not supported.

    • setState

      void setState(T state, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Sets entity state, e.g. file contents. If the entity storage does not exist this call creates the storage and intermediary containers as needed.
      Parameters:
      state - Entity state.
      monitor -
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if canWrite() returns false.

    • appendState

      void appendState(T state, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Appends state if the entity state exists and calls setState if it doesn't.
      Parameters:
      Entity - state.
      monitor -
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if canWrite() returns false.

    • canRead

      boolean canRead()
      Returns:
      true if entity state can be read. Some containers may be write-only.

    • canWrite

      boolean canWrite()
      Returns:
      true if entity state can be changed. Some containers may be read-only, e.g. a container backed by a ZipFile would only support reading resources from it.

    • copy

      default void copy(Container<? super E> container, String path, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Copies entity.
      Specified by:
      copy in interface Resource<T>
      Parameters:
      container - target container, may be the same container.
      path - Path in the target container.
      monitor - Progress monitor.

    • move

      default void move(Container<? super E> container, String path, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Moves entity. This implementation implements move as copy and delete.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Resource<T>
      Parameters:
      container - target container, may be the same container.
      path - Path in the target container.
      monitor - Progress monitor.

    • adapt

      default <V> Entity<V,E> adapt(BiFunction<Entity<T,E>,T,V> decoder, BiFunction<Entity<T,E>,V,T> encoder, BiFunction<Entity<T,E>,Long,Long> sizeConverter)
      Adapts to a different state type.
      Type Parameters:
      V -
      Parameters:
      decoder - Decodes T to V.
      encoder - Encodes V to T.
      sizeConverter - converts size of an entity. Size is passed as-is if null.
      Returns:
